wikipedia_page.main: Brian Richard Gibbs (6 October 1936 – 27 January 2014) was an English professional footballer who played as a forward.

response: In 1970 New Bradwell St Peter moved up to Division One of the South Midlands League.South Midlands League 1966–1983 Non-League Matters Under the guidance of manager Brian Gibbs the club were Division One champions in the 1976–77 season, earning promotion to the Premier Division where they spent four seasons before finishing bottom of the division in 1980–81, resulting in relegation back to Division One. The club were Division One champions again in 1983–84,South Midlands League 1983–1997 Non-League Matters this time under the management of Malc Burridge, and were promoted to the Premier Division. They finished bottom of the Premier Division in 1992–93 and were relegated to the Senior Division. In 1997 the league merged with the Spartan League to form the Spartan South Midlands League, with the club placed in the Senior Division.

Gillingham used a total of 22 players during the course of the season, two of whom, Mike Burgess and John Simpson, featured in all 52 competitive matches. Brian Gibbs was also ever-present in Football League matches, and finished the season as the team's top scorer, with 18 goals in all competitions.
